fields.name: display86
fields.fieldText: H - ABILITY TO ACCEPT APPOINTMENT

fields.name: display87
fields.fieldText: Regulated Activity?

fields.name: display88
fields.fieldText:
Does the transaction relate to one of the following regulated investments?

 

·           shares

·           instruments creating / acknowledging indebtedness

·           government and public securities

·           instruments giving entitlement to investments

·           certificates representing certain securities

·           options and futures

·           contracts for differences

·           rights to or interests in investments

fields.name: display95
fields.fieldText: If No then this is not a regulated activity. All other questions to this section become N/a and we can accept appointment without any further work

fields.name: display89
fields.fieldText:
Does the work constitute one of the following activities?

 

·           dealing in investments (as principle or agent)

·           arranging deals in investments

·           managing investments

·           safeguarding and administering investments

·           sending dematerialised instructions

·           advising on investments

·           agreeing to carry on a specified activity

fields.name: display96
fields.fieldText: If No then this is not a regulated activity. All other questions to this section become N/a and we can accept appointment without any further work

fields.name: display90
fields.fieldText:
Is the work within any of the following exclusions in the Regulated Activities Order:

 

·        generic advice and discussion with a client about different types of investments (but not discussions on a specific investments merits)

(RAO article 53)

·        introducing a client to a permitted third party

(RAO article 33)

·        advice, arranging a deal or dealing as agent regarding the sale or purchase of a body corporate where:

o the transaction may be regarded as the acquisition of day to day control over the affairs of the body corporate; or

o the shares (together with ones already held) are 50% or more of the voting rights and the transaction is between two parties each of whom is a body corporate, a partnership, a single individual or a group of connected individuals.

(RAO article 70)

﻿·        a firm can arrange a deal in investments, deal as agent in investments, safeguard and administer investments or give advice, provided:

o the firm is not separately remunerated for this work,

o the service may be regarded as a necessary part of other professional services, and

o the business or profession does not otherwise consist of regulated activities

(RAO article 67)

·        making arrangements for a client to buy, sell, subscribe for or underwrite an investment with or through a permitted third party, provided:

o the transaction is on the advice of a permitted third party or

o the client has not requested advice on the merits of the investment from the firm, or if requested, the firm has refused and suggested that the client seek advice from a permitted third party

(RAO article 29)

·        buying, selling, subscribing for or underwriting an investment as agent for a client with or through a permitted third party provided:

o the transaction is on the advice of a permitted third party or

o the client has not requested advice on the merits of the investment from the firm, or if he did, the firm has refused and suggested that the client seek advice from a permitted third party.

(RAO article 22)

fields.name: display97
fields.fieldText:
If Yes then this is not a regulated activity. All other questions to this section become N/a and we can accept appointment without any further work

 

If No this is a regulated activity and we will only be able to carry out our work under a DPB licence if it is a non-mainstream activity.

fields.name: display91
fields.fieldText: Mainstream Activity?

fields.name: display92
fields.fieldText:
Can the regulated activity be classed as one of the following?

 

·        dealing in investments as agent for a client

·        making arrangements for a person to deal

·        managing investments

·        safeguarding and administration

·        sending dematerialised instructions

·        advising

·        agreeing

fields.name: display98
fields.fieldText: If no, this is a mainstream activity and the firm must be FCA approved to act. We must reject appointment.

fields.name: display93
fields.fieldText: Does the firm receive from any person (other than the client) any pecuniary reward for which it does not account to the client?

fields.name: display99
fields.fieldText: If yes, this is a mainstream activity and the firm must be FCA approved to act. We must reject appointment

fields.name: display94
fields.fieldText: Is the regulated activity incidental to other professional services and complementary to or arising out of other professional services provided to a particular client?

fields.name: display100
fields.fieldText:
If no, this is a mainstream activity and the firm must be FCA approved to act. We must reject appointment.

 

If yes, this is a non-mainstream exempt regulated activity and we can act under our DPB licence.

fields.name: display101
fields.fieldText: Minority Investments and Financial Promotions

fields.name: display102
fields.fieldText: Are we anticipating that as a consequence of this transaction we will be promoting potential minority interests to a third party (and we are unable to rely upon RAO70)

fields.name: display105
fields.fieldText: If yes, we need to consider our position in relation to financial promotions.

fields.name: display103
fields.fieldText: In relation to potential minority interests, are we only exploring investment appetite with parties who have already expressed an interest in exploring such investment opportunities?

fields.name: display106
fields.fieldText: If no, we must cease to act as we are unable to promote investment opportunities on an unsolicited basis.

fields.name: display104
fields.fieldText:
In relation to potential minority interests, are we only exploring investment appetite with parties who we reasonably believe fall into one of the following exemptions under section 21 of the Financial Services and Markets Act 2001:

 

·        investment professional (Article 19)

·        high net worth individual (Article 48)

·        sophisticated investor (Article 50A)

·        high net worth company (Article 49)

 

A detailed description of each of these categories is provided in the resources section of the CF practice manual.

fields.name: display107
fields.fieldText:
If no, we are unable to act and we must reject appointment.

 

If yes, we can continue to act only on the basis that the appropriate disclaimers are included in our standard Important Notice at the front of any documentation

fields.name: display56
fields.fieldText: D - BACKGROUND TO ASSIGNMENT (please provide summary as it will appear in the engagement letter)

fields.fieldText: CONFLICTS OF INTEREST

fields.name: display18
fields.fieldText: Do we already act for any of the parties involved?

fields.name: display19

fields.name: display20

fields.name: display21

fields.name: display133
fields.fieldText: CONCLUSIONS

fields.name: display134
fields.fieldText: Is there anything unusual or suspicious to report?

fields.name: display135
fields.fieldText: If yes, has a report been made to the MLRO and have the suspicions remained confidential?

fields.name: display136
fields.fieldText: Have we reason to suspect a lack of integrity?

fields.name: display58
fields.fieldText: E -TRANSACTION RISKS

fields.name: display59
fields.fieldText: For disposals, what is our assessment of likely purchaser appetite. If performed, what names have we already uncovered as potential purchasers?

fields.name: display60
fields.fieldText: For MBO’s, what is the value gap between likely vendor and purchaser price expectations. How will this gap be met?

fields.name: display70
fields.fieldText: Please detail all other transactional risks.

fields.name: display71

fields.name: display80
fields.fieldText: Underwritten:

fields.name: display72

fields.name: display73

fields.name: display74

fields.name: display75

fields.name: display79

fields.name: display85

fields.name: display81
fields.fieldText: Is there public interest in this client / transaction? If yes, please explain why you wish to proceed

fields.name: display82
fields.fieldText: Are we being invited to act for only a part of the relationship / group? If yes, why?

fields.name: display83
fields.fieldText: Has the client specified any specific requirements?

fields.name: display84

fields.name: Name

fields.name: display25

fields.name: display26

fields.name: display27

fields.name: display29

fields.name: display31

fields.name: display108
fields.fieldText: I - MONEY LAUNDERING

fields.name: display109
fields.fieldText: KEY CLIENT CONTACT:

fields.name: Name_2
fields.fieldText: Name:

fields.name: Role_2
fields.fieldText: Role

fields.name: Address
fields.fieldText: Address

fields.name: display110
fields.fieldText: MONEY LAUNDERING

fields.name: display111
fields.fieldText: Do we have a good understanding of the client’s business and background?

fields.name: display112
fields.fieldText: Is this an existing client who has already been money laundered by the firm?

fields.name: display113
fields.fieldText: Even if the answer to the above is yes, please complete to following to provide support to any additional money laundering evidence.

fields.name: display114
fields.fieldText: Is the business structure complex/unusual?

fields.name: display115
fields.fieldText: Does the business/individual transact with businesses in overseas countries with weak money laundering regimes?

fields.name: display116
fields.fieldText: Is control remote?

fields.name: display117
fields.fieldText: Is it a cash business?

fields.name: display118
fields.fieldText: Are client monies held?

fields.name: display119
fields.fieldText: If you have answered “yes” to more than one question above, you must treat the client as high risk

fields.name: display120
fields.fieldText: Have we have met the individuals involved face to face:

fields.name: display121
fields.fieldText:
If “no” you must treat the client as high risk

If “yes” name the person who has met them and whom they met:

fields.name: display122
fields.fieldText: Are any of the individuals or their close family or associates PEPs?

fields.name: display123
fields.fieldText: If “yes” you must treat the client as high risk and apply Enhanced Due Diligence (EDD) procedures as set out in the firm’s Client Acceptance Guidance Notes (available on the intranet). Record EDD procedures undertaken below:

fields.name: display124
fields.fieldText: Considering the above factors, the risk of money laundering is:

fields.name: display125
fields.fieldText:
THE LEVEL OF MONEY LAUNDERING RISK ASSESSED ABOVE SHOULD BE ENTERED INTO THE CLIENT’S CCH RECORD IN THE “MONEY LAUNDERING RISK LEVEL” FIELD WHICH WILL BE FOUND UNDER THE “EXTRA” TAB.


BENEFICIAL OWNERS

 

We need to find out who ALL the owners of the client are (the most recent confirmation statement alone may NOT achieve this and earlier confirmation statements or annual returns may be needed). Then we must determine whether there are any beneficial owners (see Client Acceptance Guidance Notes) and record the basis of their beneficial ownership below:

fields.name: display126
fields.fieldText: FOR EACH INDIVIDUAL, WE HAVE ON FILE A MEANS TO:

fields.name: display129
fields.fieldText: Link their name to their permanent address

fields.name: display130
fields.fieldText: AND

fields.name: display127
fields.fieldText: For companies, trusts and partnerships – link the individuals involved to the potential client
